main event: A pilot and several Air Force personnel observed a bright, silvery disc-shaped object over Dover AFB, Delaware, on 9 March 1953 that remained stationary for around 15 minutes before rapidly departing.
interesting points: The object was first reported as a very bright light that changed colors and appeared to make fast, erratic maneuvers., The object was observed to hover and make extremely sharp turns., It was tracked on radar by the control tower and its speeds were estimated to be between 12,000 to 15,000 mph., Witnesses included six Air Force personnel, including the control tower sergeant., No physical evidence was found, and the sighting was concluded as unidentified.
witness description: Air Force personnel including the sergeant controller of the GCA station
